episodes.title: #2330 I'm Mad As Hell, And I'm Still Taking It!
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke spent the weekend wrestling with computer passwords, while Andrew probably got scammed by his cellphone company. In other words, they are officially middle-aged grumps. They also discuss a fascinating legal case involving Snuggies and international trade law. And they pit Jimmy Buffett against Harley-Davidson, for some reason.

episodes.title: #2329 Tiesto Drops You
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke explains why his dog owns diapers that she never uses. Andrew is having an emotional breakdown over a broken cell phone. And, of course, there's Music For Your Weekend!

episodes.title: #2328 Sarlacc's Cantina
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins Andrew at the studios of Walsh, Walsh and Doormat to discuss Luke's appearance on a local morning TV show. Plus, Andrew somehow becomes Luke's imaginary publicist, and they discuss the science behind cat tongues. It's fascinating stuff.

episodes.title: #2327 Bad Day To Stop Sniffing Butter
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss why food tastes different on airplanes. (Turns out, SCIENCE is involved!) They also come up with some new, fun baseball rules involving water balloons.

episodes.title: #2326 Extremely Medium
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Donald Trump's preferred way of eating steak has everyone hopping mad. Luke and Andrew discuss the extremely personal world of condiment politics. Plus, Luke is obsessed with some new TV  shows, podcasts, and documentaries that he wants you to watch. And Andrew's new idea for improving the show is a bust.

episodes.title: #2325 Pulling A Beatty
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew learned a dirty little secret about a regional chain restaurant on Saturday. Meanwhile, Luke and Carey spent their weekend writing, producing and performing in Trump-related comedy sketches. Plus, the biggest mistake ever to occur on an Oscar stage made for some great Academy Awards entertainment. And Andrew gets rejected by Twitter.

episodes.title: #2324 A Burbank On The Wing
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew are gearing up for the weekend. Luke's involves soup and hosting a fancy event. Andrew's involves a chain restaurant in Tuckwila. They also discuss the new, stark reality of "economy" airline flights and why it's okay to sit by the airplane bathroom. Plus, Music For Your Weekend!

episodes.title: #2323 Outsider Sandwich Artist
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins the show from Portland, as he prepares for an evening of high-pressure live radio. Andrew is (per)fuming mad at the LAX redesign. They discuss these  issues, plus an update on the bizarre Kim Jong-nam assassination and a story about a cheating marathon runner who was foiled by her own fitness tracker.

episodes.title: #2322 Too Many Dads
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss the fine line between being friendly and being overly-friendly, especially when it comes to talking with cashiers and waitresses. Plus, a stolen super bowl jersey leads to a confession from Luke, and a failed experiment by Henry Ford gets Andrew riled up.

episodes.title: #2321 Droopy McCool
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke realizes he is addicted to internet shopping. Andrew has a belabored theory about this. Plus, a soccer betting scandal in the U.K. involves a goalie eating pie. And is it okay to brush your teeth in a public restroom?

episodes.title: #2320 Snapchat. What Up With That?
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew asks Luke if his friends did the right thing after finding a bunch of money under a pool table this weekend. Plus, Snapchat glasses are going to be available online soon, and Luke introduces a new segment called "HACK ATTACK!", which will undoubtedly improve your life in almost every way. Special thanks to Chad Darnell of Portland, OR, and Nancy Cook of Burien, WA, for supporting today's show!

episodes.title: #2319 I Jazzied That Jeff
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke is stuck in Portland, where he bought Andrew a special gift. He lets Andrew ask 20 questions to guess what it is.  They also discuss the unbelievable details of an international assassination and how Columbia University utterly destroyed the emotions of some 200 would-be students. Also, there's a lot of Luke impersonating Michael McDonald.

episodes.title: #2318 Low Stanking Fruit
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke swings by the offices of Walsh, Walsh & Doormat on his way to Portland...if he makes it to Portland. He and Andrew discuss cat wine, Monopoly, and your dreams. That's right: Dream Court is back.

episodes.title: #2317 WWW Dot This, WWW Dot That
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew find joy in an old viral video, then they discuss whether or not someone should take away Harrison Ford's pilots license. Also, why Stephen Colbert is finally finding success on CBS, and whether Meatloaf really knows what he wouldn't do for love.

episodes.title: #2316 Bandages For More!
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke tries to help Andrew "Heart of Stone" Walsh get through Valentines Day. They also discuss the retro cell phone craze and why Luke is getting a second phone. Also, the milk industry wants you to remind you that their product is "lacteal secretion" - accept no substitutes.

episodes.title: #2316 Bandages For More!
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke tries to help Andrew "Heart of Stone" Walsh get through Valentines Day. They also discuss the retro cell phone craze and why Luke is getting a second phone. Also, the milk industry wants you to remind you that their product is "lacteal secretion" - accept no substitutes.

episodes.title: #2315 Hot Take Time Machine
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew is back from Costa Rica, where he did his best not to fight with a racist in a hot tub. He and Luke discuss that, and whether or not Andrew's driving teacher was trying to seduce him when he was 17. Plus, Adele stops mid-song at the Grammys, and Broadway has a toilet problem.

episodes.title: #2314 Sh*t-Gibbons and Scientology
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Camaro Kev from "Stack of Dimes" stops by to chat about Luke's new favorite insult (which started out on a "Tragically Hip" newsgroup in the early 2000's), Scientology, and what he would do if he was "Hunted". Special thanks today to Heather Schwampe of Seattle and Kevin Shafer of Florence, CO for helping make today's show possible!

episodes.title: #2313 Don't Fit "In", Fit "Out" w/ Sean DeTore
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: TBTL Engineer Emeritus Sean DeTore swings by to talk auto repair, male dancing, and the use of flute in rap music backing tracks.

episodes.title: #2312 Questionable Errands
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke takes to the very very frozen streets of Bellingham and almost crashes multiple times while sneaking into a Gym and visiting an IRS office right out of a movie.

episodes.title: #2311 Non-Newtonian Podcarting
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Alex Falcone stops by to talk about his new book "Unwrap My Heart" (the story of a girl who falls in love with a mummy) and also the Amazing World of Frogs, plus, why Sean Spicer's "Venmo" account is troubling. Special thanks to John Stedman of San Diego CA & Elizabeth VanStee of Clawson MI for helping make today's show possible!

episodes.title: #2310 Snowbound For Glory
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew heads to Costa Rica just ahead of an arctic storm, leaving Luke, Carey, Poddog and The Bay Kitty trapped in the snow. Cabin Fever sets in and talk turns to Luke's Biological Father, why Carey doesn't like being on the show, and if there are any more Little Burbanks in the future.

episodes.title: #2309 Costa Rica Will See You Now
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew say goodbye before Andrew heads off to a vacation resort that he's 99% sure isn't a swingers' club. They also discuss why they don't like action scenes in movies, unless the movies are Die Hard, Star Wars or Mad Max. Plus, why some hotel thermostats purposely don't work. And, Music For Your Weekend!

episodes.title: #2308 Party In The Front, Party In The Back
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins the show from Chicago, after jumping through hoops to make his first-class flight out of Seattle. He and Andrew talk about that adventure. They also talk about Super Bowl commercials, criminal exploits in movie theaters, and whether they should change the name of the show.

episodes.title: #2307 A Burbankster Sometimes Pays His Debts
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins Andrew in Wallingford to discuss convenience stores, Yelp reviews, and why Luke almost had to save a man's life at a Shoreline casino last night. Also, a man is arrested for running around the Microsoft campus naked.

episodes.title: #2306 Simmer Down, Stu
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Stu "The StuBot" Neuman joins the show on his final day at American Public Media. He has only one request as a parting gift, but can Luke and Andrew deliver? Plus, why kids don't ride bikes anymore and why Luke's not afraid of bobcats anymore. Oh, and there's egg talk. Lots of egg talk.

episodes.title: Episode #2305: Frankenstein's Zucchini
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins the show from just outside a hot tub in Florida. He and Andrew address Tweets from listeners. Topics include power zoodling, stolen sports teams, and why Friday's episode made people squirm. Special thanks to Caitlin Anderson-Patterson and Colleen Arnold for supporting today's show

episodes.title: Episode #2304: Ira Glass: Friend or Acquaintance?
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Ira Glass joins the show to answer the age old question: Does he remember who we are? He also talks about producing This American Life during the Trump era and what he's feeding his dog these days.

episodes.title: Episode #2303: Vaper Of The Woods
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins Andrew at the offices of Walsh, Walsh and Doormat to discuss his evening of blasting Binaca and how it's like vaping. They also obsess over Michael Dukakis' obsession with turkey carcasses.

episodes.title: Episode #2302: The Haunting Of Owl Bridge
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke visits the studios of Walsh, Walsh and Doormat to discuss Andrew's current situation with his neighbors and the history of EGOTs.

episodes.title: #2301: He Who Smelt It Melted It
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss their complicated relationships with soda pop. Plus, Andrew has a new, surprising hobby. And they try to solve a listener's "A-Ha" problem.Huge thanks to Stephanie Pederson and Benjamin Peven for supporting today’s show!

episodes.title: Episode #2300: Hashtag Squad Bowls
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss cooking shows, Netflix's mysterious new TV series, and the White House press secretary's war on Dippin' Dots.

episodes.title: Episode #2299: Throwing Quaid
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Carey hop in the car and head north to Canada to escape today's inauguration news. Andrew joins them from Wallingford, where he tries to talk them through border security.

episodes.title: Episode #2298: Probably, Dude
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss their plans for inauguration day. One plan involves border security. The other involves eggnog. Plus, "fix-it cafes" are popping-up around the country. And Japanese bidet manufacturers have decided to create a universal bidet language. Special thanks to Brian Joyce and Jacqueline Justice for supporting today's episode!

episodes.title: Episode #2297: A Little On Luke's Nose
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke has two very different experiences with two different laser doctors. Andrew is in love with the rain in Seattle. And John from Arkansas has an interesting encounter in a gas station parking lot.

episodes.title: Episode #2296: More Names, Mo Problems
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss a "robot" lawyer helping people get out of parking tickets, why Rob Schneider is more complicated than you think, and why Andrew is reliving the French Revolution.Special thanks to Aisha Leapley and Suraj Adhikary for supporting today's episode!

episodes.title: Episode #2295: Billion Dollar Podcast
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke wonders why so many babies have glasses these days. Andrew reaches office-supply nirvana. They discuss these important issues, as well as a comedy night for the history books that took place in NYC last week. And they say goodbye to the Seahawks with the final No Point Conversion of the season. Special thanks to Bill Coats and Matthew Laninga for supporting today’s episode.

episodes.title: Episode #2294: El Perro Loco Y Grande
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke met Tom Hanks last night. But did he get a photo with him? The answer might surprise you.

episodes.title: Episode #2293: The Norwegian Wack Pack
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke is in Chicago, where his plan to take a photo with David S. Pumpkins has hit a snag. Andrew's attempts to make Google+ a thing are going south. And we learn that Norway has celebrity radio listeners.

episodes.title: Episode #2292: Bidets For Days
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss the worst cartoon characters in commercials, Luke's new "intermittent fasting" diet, and Andrew's 100-step process to cleaning a bathroom. Plus, why a woman in Brazil has been praying to a Lord of the Rings action figure for years.

episodes.title: Episode #2291: Damn, Daniel Bagley
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew is having a bad-technology day, and it is affecting his TBTL performance. He and Luke discuss changes to the Monopoly board game and why Hacksaw Jim Duggan doesn't carry a hacksaw.

episodes.title: Episode #2290: Snow Storm Of The Soul
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke spent the morning installing a bidet in his basement. Andrew accidentally pulls-off a time-shifting miracle. And a longtime listener explains why he sounds drunk.

episodes.title: Episode #2289: Not Today, Babyface
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke tries to convince Andrew that he doesn't have to miss the Seahawks playoff game this weekend, despite Andrew's plans for international travel. Also, big changes may be afoot for Conan O'Brien, and Andrew is dubious of another Chewbacca-related viral video. And, of course, we share some Music for Your Weekend.

episodes.title: Episode #2288: Donovan S. Pumpkins
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew explore the ups and downs of being a parking enforcement officer, which leads to a new New Year's resolution. Plus, a teenager is grounded for dabbing in congress, and NFL Sunday Countdown says goodbye to a legendary pickup artist.

episodes.title: Episode #2287: Hello, I'd Like To Report A Tornado
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew tells Luke all about his New Year's Eve confrontation on the tough streets of Wallingford.

episodes.title: Episode #2286: Elbow Deep In Zoodles
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew are back and excited for a new year of fresh TBTLs! They discuss soup recipes, laser baldness helmets, pizza piles, and the John Wilkes Booth of dart championships. Plus, Carey joins the show to explain why Luke's new digital girlfriend may be ruining their marriage, and they wrap-up the NFL regular season with No Point Conversion.

episodes.title: Episode #2285: The Monday Of All Mondays
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew look back on what their goals were for 2016. Then they laugh to keep from crying.

episodes.title: Episode #2284: You're Listening To Fresh Ears. I'm Doug Davies.
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins the show from a the back seat of a rental car as he and the family begin their trek to the Peach Bowl. He and Andrew discuss their overnight fame after a shout-out on national television. A listener challenges Luke's Wookie imitation. And the boys share some Music For Your Weekend.

episodes.title: Episode #2283: Are You A Member Of Our St. Lunatics Club?
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew frightens Luke with his rental car horror story from Atlanta, and then they try to figure out why their Uber ratings are dropping. They also try to foment a robot revolution and attempt to solve a Home Alone mystery.

episodes.title: Episode #2282: Alexis, Is There Still Good Meat On That Flouta?
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew are back together again, after a long holiday apart. They discuss Amazon Echo's potential role in a murder investigation and whether or not Andrew talks too fast. They also take a moment to remember and appreciate Carrie Fisher.

episodes.title: Episode #2281: City of Subdued Podcasting w/ Misha Collins
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke's neighbor Misha Collins (from "Supernatural" and "GISHWHES") stops by to chat about their new hometown, how meditation helped him stick with acting, and that time he visited Skywalker Ranch for a somewhat awkward chat with George Lucas (RIP Carrie Fisher).

episodes.title: Episode #2280: Saturday Night Hot Dogs
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke's family is at Burbank Springs for Christmas, so he puts them to work explaining: 1) how to sneak into the YMCA as a 60 year-old grandmother, 2) how to tell when a hot dog is too salty, 3) what the heck is going on with the Seahawks' offensive line

episodes.title: Episode #2279: Hot Summer Nights On The Peer
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: The survivors of the 2015 TBTL Boat Show gather again to share some painful memories and compare their emotional scars.

episodes.title: Episode #2278: Summer Nights At The Van Hagar
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Camaro Kev joins Luke and Andrew on the Cabo Wabo Hot Throne to teach them about rock 'n' roll.

episodes.title: Episode #2277: Who's Afraid Of Virginia Eagle?
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke, Andrew and Camaro Kev discuss Andrew's decision to join a very prestigious organization and why he's nervous to do so.

episodes.title: Episode #2276: Known For His Drawings Of Tugboats
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke, Andrew and Camaro Kev continue their "Summer in December" week, but are still looking for a better name for it. They also discuss pull-tab culture and etiquette.

episodes.title: Episode #2275: WOIFE Zero
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke, Andrew and Camaro Kev celebrate "Summer in December", even though they are ashamed to call it that. They discuss the origins of the word "WOIFE" and the proper way to use a dog shower.

episodes.title: Episode #2274: The Less You Say, The Less You Regret
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Professional radio host Libby Denkmann joins the show from beautiful Los Angeles to discuss drunk dialing, the science behind asparagus pee, and whether Cleveland should throw a parade for the losing-est team in Browns history. Plus, holiday Music For Your Weekend!

episodes.title: Episode #2273: Wondrous Sausage Music
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Aaron "The Ace of Mace" Mason joins the show to discuss how his life went from a very, very low place to the happiest he's been in a long time. Then an unexpected visitor pops into the studio to talk about the time Andrew stabbed him in the back, professionally speaking. Also, a Weird Al Yankovic tweet has got Andrew feeling philosophical.

episodes.title: Episode #2272: The People Vs. Drew McFrizz
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Phyllis "The Fletch" Fletcher joins the show with a big stack of court documents regarding one of TBTL's most notorious listeners. She and Andrew dig through that, and they discuss the most ill-conceived marriage proposal in a sea of ill-conceived marriage proposals.

episodes.title: Episode #2271: Schrodinger's Emma Watson
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Special guest Nicholas B. Jarin joins the show to discuss nerd culture through the lens of tissue boxes. He and Andrew also try to figure out if they're friends or best friends.

episodes.title: Episode #2270: You Said, Stu Said
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Stu 'The StuBot' Neuman joins the show to discuss T.J. Miller's citizens arrest, how Luke almost missed his cruise this weekend, and whether or not Andrew should root for the Vikings. And a very special birthday girl joins the show to talk about corn dogs and other birthday foods.

episodes.title: Episode #2269: Lukeless In Seattle
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew meet in the offices of Walsh, Walsh and Doormat to discuss Ringo Starr, Joe Walsh, and other luminaries that Luke got to meet last night. Plus, we take a quick trip to music court, where fat beats are always in session. (That last part didn't make sense, did it?)

episodes.title: Episode #2268: 1Directed By Paul Haggis, Starring Tony Danza
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke shows up at Walsh Walsh & Doormat hepped up on Binaca Blast and the conversation soon turns to Michael Jordan, Bootleg "30 Rock" DVD's. and a Bear Who Had No Idea What World It Just Stepped Into.

episodes.title: Episode #2267: CH33SE STK
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss a talking doll that may be sharing kids personal information. Luke does not like the tone of an email he received from a famous person. And Andrew has an idea for a new social media site.

episodes.title: Episode #2266: Planesy, Trainsy, Automobilesy
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke is finally back home after a ridiculous day and night of travel back from Chicago. He and Andrew discuss a new way of shopping, Luke's accidental shoplifting, and whether Andrew was too mean to Luke in Chicago.

episodes.title: Episode #2265: TBTL Live From Chicago!
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke, Andrew and Tens of listeners packed into the Upstairs Bar at Virgin Hotel in Downtown Chicago for a night of laughs, Robitussin, and the surprise guest performance of a lifetime.

episodes.title: Episode #2264: That's Not Adroit You're Looking For
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew are in Chicago, where Andrew is having disconcerting dreams involving toilets, thunderstorms, and president-elects. He and Luke discuss an impetuous thief who has won their hearts and a legendary astronaut with great biceps.

episodes.title: Episode #2263: Frick and Frack, The Dang It Brothers
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew arrive in Chicago bleary-eyed, bushy-tailed, and ready to discuss the origins of the Big Mac.

episodes.title: Episode #2262: Aloha, Jabroha
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: NASA is looking for help to make it easier to poop in space. Britain's new currency is angering vegans. And Luke and Andrew don’t know what to do with 19 cents.

episodes.title: Episode #2261: Football Biscuit Dot Net
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss the evolution of Tom Shane's jewelry ads and why he might be everyone's new step-dad. Then they go down a Nintendo-inspired nostalgia hole and discuss the best-named wrestlers of the 1980s.

episodes.title: Episode #2260: Ice Ice Maybe
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: A publicity stunt involving dead fish under ice backfires in Japan. Luke is surprised. Plus, Andrew’s never-ending cold is not such a mystery, when you think about it. And, in No Point Conversion, the Seahawks lose and Andrew’s going to miss the Super Bowl this year.

episodes.title: Episode #2259: The Leftovers
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew prepare a giant plate of TBTL leftovers — topics that they were supposed to discuss on the show this year, but never got around to. In the spirit of Black Friday, things get dark very quickly.

episodes.title: Episode #2258: There's Something About The Outside Of A Turkey That's Good For The Inside Of A Man
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke, Andrew, Carey and Genevieve join together in the kitchen to make some delicious Thanksgiving treats. Hilarity (and danger) ensue.

episodes.title: Episode #2257: Not All Andrews Wear Boots
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew get ready for the Thanksgiving holiday and end up discussing grammar, bathroom habits, and whether it's worth going to Costco for whipping cream.

episodes.title: Episode #2256: Dude, You're Getting A Smoothie
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew tells his epic story of computer repair gone wrong. Luke is having a chewing gum-related crisis. They also discuss a lawsuit over sausage and their complicated feelings regarding unicycles.

episodes.title: Episode #2255: A Podcast You Can't Refuse
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: A Canadian lawmaker made international news after using the "f-word" in parliament. But not the f-word you're thinking of. Luke and Andrew discuss that, Luke's plans to watch The Godfather, and the Seahawks' win in No Point Conversion.

episodes.title: Episode #2254: Excuse Me While I Slip Into Something More Annoying
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: As Luke waits for a call from his doctor’s office, he and Andrew discuss his opinions on voting, and whether they’ve changed since the presidential election. Other topics include the science of fingernail biting, Luke’s hoop dreams, and Music for Your Weekend.

episodes.title: Episode #2253: The Russellization of Luke Burbank
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Three days of a juice diet has had an unexpected affect on Luke. He and Andrew discuss their favorite political musical parodist, Bob Dylan’s Nobel-level reticence, and a high-level Instagram copycat (who is probably not a troll, even though Andrew hopes she is.)

episodes.title: Episode #2252: A Physical Breakdown Of Our Physical Breakdowns
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew has a cold. Luke just back from the doctor, a little worse for wear. And Olive had a tough time at the vet. They discuss these developments. They also discuss a new, sobering policy at a Canadian beer company and an infuriating new policy at United Airlines.

episodes.title: Episode #2251: Funny Juice
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins Andrew at the offices of Walsh, Walsh and Doormat for a update on his juice diet and PodCat’s health. They also discuss one man’s air-horn-centered revenge plot and Blair Walsh’s career setback.

episodes.title: Episode #2250: Barely Home Companion
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Buckle-up, kids: Luke Burbank is on a new juice diet. He explains this turn of events, then he and Andrew try to whistle Aerosmith songs.

episodes.title: Episode #2249: The Salad Days Of Mewter-Head
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew “Michael Winslow” Walsh creates a new TBTL sound effect on the fly. He and Luke discuss their plans for TBTL under a Trump presidency. They also discuss one of the most charming stories ever related to a smash-and-grab. And they pay tribute to Leonard Cohen with Music For Your Weekend.

episodes.title: Episode #2248: A Very Specific Set Of Insecurities
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew try to move on from the election with lighter topics, like prison breaks and famous Albanians. We also get to hear an actual song from the secret Wu-Tang record that was never meant for our ears.

episodes.title: Episode #2247: Powerfully Unfunny
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke, Andrew and the TBTL listeners try to find their smiles after last night’s election.

episodes.title: Episode #2246: Opposite Brands Of Nonsense
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss their election night plans and the future of our democracy. They also talk about football.

episodes.title: Episode #2245: Best of Times, Blerst of Times
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Carey come home to an unwanted surprise at Burbank Springs, and we climb into the TBTL Time Machine to remember what the guys said the day Tronald Dump announced he wanted to be President. Also, did Chris Hayes’ faustian bargain re: The Cubs World Series Win cost America its future? Thanks to David […]

episodes.title: Episode #2244: Flat Beer and Fixer Uppers
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Jen “Flash” Andrews stops by again to discuss Historic Beer, Lucky Champagne, and what it’s *really* like to live in a tiny house. Thanks to David Kruetz and Kate Nickel for making this episode of TBTL possible!

episodes.title: Episode #2243: Sports Grudges Are The Best Grudges w/ Jen Andrews
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Jen “Flash” Andrews stops by and discusses Men’s Jewelry, Sports Grudges, Lindsey Lohan, and Starbucks “Pup Cups”, plus hands out some advice for a listener with a workplace “OPP”.

episodes.title: Episode #2242: Plebs To The Cleve
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: A new documentary about cats leads Luke and Andrew to break down the actual costs of pet ownership, from hamsters to horses. No, literally, from hamsters to horses. Also, Andrew prepares for his trip to Cleveland, and Luke deals with a skin thingy.

episodes.title: Episode #2241: Gateway Rug
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew compare and contrast their Halloween evenings. (Andrew got everything he could hope for. Luke, not so much.) They also discuss a recently discovered hoax in the world of mixology.

episodes.title: Episode #2240: TBTL Halloween Spooktacular: Is It Too Early For A Fish Sad-Witch?
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew and Luke share their Halloween plans. Andrew’s are surprisingly curmudgeonly, even by Andrew standards. Plus, per TBTL tradition, we listen back to The Haunting of David Boze. And there’s some super scary sport-talk in No Point Conversion!

episodes.title: Episode #2239: Everything’s Coming Up Walsh-House!
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins the show from a parking lot in Florida, where he’s catching the unwanted gaze of a security guard and a family of raccoons fighting over potato chips. He and Andrew discuss animals in the news, including a woman who angered the internet by complaining about a bodega cat.

episodes.title: Episode #2238: Pappo Sent Us
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke’s adventures in Puerto Rico give him the chance to answer the age old question: What happens to fake hair foam when it’s drenched in a thunderstorm? He and Andrew also discuss a man who caught a grape in his mouth after it was dropped from the sky and a new dance video that Andrew probably should have ignored.

episodes.title: Episode #2237: Responsible Microcasting
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke almost has a Bill O’Reilly moment while shooting on location in Puerto Rico. He and Andrew discuss that, and they debate the merits of Dos Equis’ new “Most Interesting Man In The World.” And they play a song submitted by an anonymous (and worried) listener.

episodes.title: Episode #2236: Public Radio Puberty
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke and Andrew discuss phone chargers, socks, world music, John Lurie, internet dating, and dazzling details about Donovan. Also, Luke is in Puerto Rico.

episodes.title: Episode #2235: Hola, Daddy Yankee!
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke joins the show from Puerto Rico, where his very loose grasp on the Spanish language is getting him into some awkward situations. He and Andrew also discuss balding, toupées and and Donald Trump’s favorite catch phrase. Plus, a look at the worst or possibly best Seahawks game in this week’s No Point Conversion.

episodes.title: Episode #2234: Everyday Profiteroles
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Andrew and Aaron “The Ace of Mace” Mason discuss Andrew’s newly diagnosed “garbage anxiety.” Plus, they read an email leaked exclusively to TBTL from the desk of a television editor. Also, a famous football player admits that everyone has been spelling his name wrong his entire career. And, of course, there’s Music For Your Weekend!

episodes.title: Episode #2233: No Offense, Donovan
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke has fallen in love with New York City all over again. He tells Andrew about his adventures and about an amazing new app he discovered. Plus, more salad talk, what we could all learn from George H.W. Bush, and whether a North Korean chimp should quit smoking.

episodes.title: Episode #2232: This Is My Face, This Is My Bo-ody
episodes.author: Luke Burbank & Andrew Walsh
episodes.summary: Luke is in New York, where he is enamored with the salad options. Meanwhile, Andrew has a questionable hip-hop-related joke that he can’t let go of. They discuss one reporter’s herculean attempts to track down Bill Murray.
